title: Returns a list of users
description: Optional extended description in CommonMark or HTML.

tabs.title: shell
tabs.code:
curl --request  \
     --url 'http://api.example.com/v1?limit=20&offset=0' \
     --header 'accept: application/json'

tabs.title: javascript
python
tabs.code:
import requests

url = "http://api.example.com/v1?limit=20&offset=0"

headers = {"accept": "application/json"}

response = requests.request("", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

tabs.title: go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "http://api.example.com/v1?limit=20&offset=0"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

tabs.title: application/json

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Maximum number of items to return

tabs.title: shell
tabs.code:
curl --request  \
     --url http://api.example.com/v1 \
     --header 'accept: application/json' \
     --header 'content-type: application/json' \
     --data '
{
  "username": "string",
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "status": "active"
}
'

tabs.title: javascript
python
go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "http://api.example.com/v1"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"username\":\"string\",\"email\":\"user@example.com\",\"status\":\"active\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

tabs.code:

  "updatedAt": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z"
}

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "http://api.example.com/v1"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"title\":\"string\",\"content\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
